text: Tata Power increased its renewable generation capacity to 5.5 GW in FY2024, representing 38% of its total portfolio.
The company achieved a 25% reduction in scope 1 emissions compared to the FY2020 baseline through solar expansion and process optimization.
Over 1.2 million people benefited from Tata Power’s CSR programs in education, livelihood, and skill development during FY2024.
Tata Power announced plans to reach net-zero emissions by 2045, advancing its target by five years.
The company will invest ₹75,000 crore over the next decade in renewable infrastructure and smart grids.
Infosys recorded a 12% reduction in scope 1 emissions in FY2023 compared to FY2020 baseline, driven by energy efficiency and renewable purchases.
The company achieved carbon neutrality across all its global operations in FY2022.
Infosys has trained over 2.5 million people through its digital and sustainability learning platforms.
Infosys outlines a bolder ESG Vision 2030; aspires to become climate positive by 2030 and expands global skilling and livelihood commitments.
The company’s ESG 2030 roadmap focuses on circular economy, diversity, and tech-for-good initiatives.
Coal India planted over 10 million saplings in FY2024 as part of its land reclamation and green cover expansion efforts.
The company reduced particulate matter emissions by 15% through advanced dust suppression systems.
Coal India announced plans to invest ₹20,000 crore in clean coal technologies and carbon capture initiatives by 2030.
Despite rising production, Coal India reaffirmed its commitment to environmental rehabilitation and community development.
The Honest Company achieved a 90% reduction in single-use plastic packaging across its product lines, verified by third-party auditors.
Auditors confirmed that HonestCo’s supply chain partners now comply with 100% renewable electricity usage.
HonestCo announced a new transparency dashboard allowing customers to trace the sustainability footprint of each product.
The dashboard integrates supplier data and real-time lifecycle emissions.
GreenwashCo claims all its operations are powered by renewable energy, though the company has not published independent verification reports.
The company’s environmental disclosure page lacks scope 3 emissions data, raising transparency concerns.
NGO watchdog GreenWatch accused GreenwashCo of overstating its carbon neutrality claims.
Analysts noted that GreenwashCo purchased renewable certificates instead of reducing actual emissions.
